intro: Paeonia officinalis proles microcarpa, commonly known as the Persian peony, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant has large, palmately lobed leaves that are deeply cut and covered in a fine down. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
